content.question: One end of a string is attached to an object of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the other end of the string is secured so that the object is at rest as it hangs from the string. When the object is raised to a height above its lowest point and released from rest, the object undergoes simple harmonic motion with a frequency <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. In a second scenario, the length of the string is cut in half before the object undergoes simple harmonic motion again. What is the new frequency of oscillation of the object in terms of <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over the square root of 2, end fraction, times f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
